title: Ethnicity in Politics Online Data Centre
abstractText:
The project will create an online data centre based around the new Ethnic Minorities British Election Study (EMBES) conducted after the last general and local elections in May 2010 (ESRC grant RES-062-23-1953) and covering key aspects of ethnicity in British politics. 

The main results from the survey will be explained briefly and in a non-specialist way. The data will be presented in the form of graphs and charts.These charts will be interactive allowing users to amend them to their own needs in a very simple fashion. Where there is a relevant question in the main British Election Study 2010, from the 1997 Ethnic Minority Election Survey (a predecessor to the EMBES), or from other studies such as the governmentâ€™s Citizenship Surveys, comparison will be provided in order to enable users to put the answers of ethnic minorities into context.

The findings of the EMBES survey will also be put into a broader context by adding other existing data on ethnicity and politics in Britain (such as data on ethnic minority candidates and MPs) and featuring a 'news blog' to showcase the most interesting results of EMBES and other related research.
